abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            property information in Serbia. When Serbia started land
            administration reforms in 2004, only nine percent of all
            cadaster municipalities had unified and updated property and
            ownership records. Many land transaction records were
            incomplete, out of date, or not noted at all. Real Estate
            Cadastre and Registration Project has established a unified
            register for almost all of the cadaster municipalities. The
            project also supported training for more than 1,500
            employees, thirty six cadastre premises were refurbished and
            modernized, two new buildings were built, digital archives
            established, and a national network of forty four permanent
            global positioning system stations developed
